intro: Alsophila pycnoneura, commonly known as the narrow-leaf tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its slender, upright trunk and feathery, compound fronds that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is known for its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its fronds are typically dark green and can grow quite long, contributing to its ornamental value. Alsophila pycnoneura is often used in horticulture for its aesthetic appeal and can be found in various gardens and conservation areas.
